channel.title: Beat the Clock #14
channel.description:
As [previously mentioned](https://disco.auxy.co/t/beat-the-clock-is-coming-back-in-a-new-form/1516), there will be a new producer hosting each "Beat the Clock".
The first host is @Southborne who will present this week's challenge below. He will also pick the shortlist on Monday.
Have fun and play nicely!

item.title: Beat the Clock #14
item.dc:creator: MysteryMan65
item.description:
Now there’s 376

Read full topic

item.title: Beat the Clock #14
item.dc:creator: InfinityBeatz
item.description:
Jesus christ. Mr. Anderson made a absolute terrific track. It had so much feeling packed into it! I think he deserved to win this round of BTC. Good job to ALLL the entries! I hope everyone had fun, ill talk to you guys later and always Keep ona Rockin!

Read full topic

item.title: Beat the Clock #14
item.dc:creator: MisterMaster
item.description:
The most popular links are listed at the top of the thread. You can drop down that list to see more links. Although, that’s largely determined by who posted first & doesn’t show the less-clicked submissions. @Auxy is it possible to have the BTC threads show all of the links, not just the summary? That would make life easier for the judge too.

Read full topic

item.title: Beat the Clock #14
item.dc:creator: TheRealJFalc
item.description:
I definitely agree with this one, maybe a condensed thread with just the links would be even more helpful. I also liked that there were more entries this time included on the short list even if I wasn’t on it I loved the larger odds ^w^

Read full topic

item.title: Beat the Clock #14
item.dc:creator: Bassment_Chemists
item.description:
I like the new format, gives us a list to listen to all submissions, I used to have to search for beat the clock on soundcloud and then scrub through a bunch of old btc from prior weeks. This way I basically have a book mark of where I left off listening

Read full topic

item.title: Beat the Clock #14
item.dc:creator: Haxerist
item.description:
Be like the rest of us and just hope for the best, you cannot be certain you were gonna appear on the shortlist.

Read full topic

item.title: Beat the Clock #14
item.dc:creator: Zeph
item.description:
I was suprised mine didn’t win, I actually thought mine was pretty good. Oh well, better luck next time Congrats to all that won!

Read full topic

item.title: Beat the Clock #14
item.dc:creator: Michael_Raskin
item.description:
Aww @Southborne you tricked me haha. when you liked my BTC I thought I was going to be in the shortlist. Glad you still liked it enough to give it a like haha.

Read full topic

item.title: Beat the Clock #14
item.dc:creator: TheRealJFalc
item.description:
Thanks ^w^ Do you have any possible advice? I’m always seeking to improve

item.title: Beat the Clock #14
item.dc:creator: TheRealJFalc
item.description:
I know you weren’t biased, I saw that you liked the one I did ^w^ I meant in general there will be a tendency towards the earlier posters especially among the community as they will be the most visible. No fault to you at all here, just a simple fact of message boards x3

Read full topic

item.description:

item.description:

item.title: Beat the Clock #14
item.dc:creator: TheRealJFalc
item.description:
I personally feel the format went well, even if a bit biased towards the individuals who posted first as opposed to those who took their time. I enjoy these as they challenge my abilities and push myself to the limit.

item.description:
Thanks @Southborne for hosting this edition, and thanks to everyone participating!

Feels like it’s a nice format to run the challenges in the forum and enable a conversation. How do you like the format?
